intro: Piper constipatispicum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved pepper plant, is a species of flowering plant in the family Piperaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil and Peru. The plant is characterized by its small, dark green leaves and clusters of tiny, white flowers that bloom throughout the year. Its fruits are small, round berries that turn from green to red as they mature. The plant is often cultivated for its ornamental value and as a source of essential oils.
